parameters.name: X
parameters.description: X coordinate anywhere within the closed sketch profile

parameters.name: Y
parameters.description: Y coordinate anywhere within the closed sketch profile

parameters.name: Z
parameters.description: Z coordinate anywhere within the closed sketch profile

parameters.name: Angle
parameters.description: Angle of the hatch if the hatch is not solid

parameters.name: Scale
parameters.description: Scale factor for the hatch if the hatch is not solid

parameters.name: Color
parameters.description: COLORREF value describing the color used for the hatch

parameters.name: Hatchname
parameters.description: Type or name of the hatch from the Sldwks.ptn file

parameters.name: Layername
parameters.description: Layer name for the hatch if a drawing document

title: ISketchManager.CreateRegionHatch
description: Creates an area hatch/fill region hatch using a closed sketch profile.
signature:
SketchHatch CreateRegionHatch( 
   System.Double
X
,
   System.Double
Y
,
   System.Double
Z
,
   System.Double
Angle
,
   System.Double
Scale
,
   System.Int32
Color
,
   System.String
Hatchname
,
   System.String
Layername
)

parameters.name: X
parameters.description: X coordinate anywhere within the closed sketch profile

parameters.name: Y
parameters.description: Y coordinate anywhere within the closed sketch profile

parameters.name: Z
parameters.description: Z coordinate anywhere within the closed sketch profile

parameters.name: Angle
parameters.description: Angle of the hatch if the hatch is not solid

parameters.name: Scale
parameters.description: Scale factor for the hatch if the hatch is not solid

parameters.name: Color
parameters.description: COLORREF value describing the color used for the hatch

parameters.name: Hatchname
parameters.description: Type or name of the hatch from the Sldwks.ptn file

parameters.name: Layername
parameters.description: Layer name for the hatch if a drawing document

remarks: This method creates a single area hatch/fill region hatch. All three point coordinates are important. This point is compared to all sketch contours to determine one unique external sketch region that contains the point.
